answerText: catalysts[10] A catalyst that has a different phase than the molecules it acts upon is given this name. This type of catalyst is often mixed with a support in order to increase its surface area.
heading: Penn Bowl |2012 | Editors Packet 3 | 19 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: One of these substances named for Lindlar is used to transform alkynes into cis-alkenes and is notably poisoned by lead acetate. For 10 points each: [10] Identify these chemical reagents which speed up reactions by lowering the activation energy.
